worklogs.comment:
BACtaki commented on pull request #4769: ARROW-1324 [C++] Support ARROW_BOOST_VENDORED on Windows / MSVC
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4769
 
 
   Adding a check to use the correct executable for vendor boostcpp libraries on Windows.
   
   Author: Badrul Chowdhury (badrulchowdhury17@gmail.com)
   Reviewers: @wesm 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on pull request #4769: ARROW-1324 [C++] Support ARROW_BOOST_VENDORED on Windows / MSVC
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4769#discussion_r299243776
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -512,15 +512,34 @@ macro(build_boost)
   set(BOOST_BUILD_PRODUCTS ${BOOST_STATIC_SYSTEM_LIBRARY}
                            ${BOOST_STATIC_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY}
                            ${BOOST_STATIC_REGEX_LIBRARY})
-  set(BOOST_CONFIGURE_COMMAND "./bootstrap.sh" "--prefix=${BOOST_PREFIX}"
-                              "--with-libraries=filesystem,regex,system")
+  if(MSVC)
+    set(BOOST_CONFIGURE_COMMAND "bootstrap.bat" "--prefix=${BOOST_PREFIX}"
+                                "--with-libraries=filesystem,regex,system")
+  else()
+    set(BOOST_CONFIGURE_COMMAND "./bootstrap.sh" "--prefix=${BOOST_PREFIX}"
+                                "--with-libraries=filesystem,regex,system")
+  endif()
+
   if("${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE}" STREQUAL "DEBUG")
     set(BOOST_BUILD_VARIANT "debug")
   else()
     set(BOOST_BUILD_VARIANT "release")
   endif()
-  set(BOOST_BUILD_COMMAND "./b2" "link=${BOOST_BUILD_LINK}"
-                          "variant=${BOOST_BUILD_VARIANT}" "cxxflags=-fPIC")
+  if(MSVC)
+    set(BOOST_BUILD_COMMAND
+        "b2.exe"
+        "link=${BOOST_BUILD_LINK}"
+        "variant=${BOOST_BUILD_VARIANT}"
+        "address-model=64"
+        "toolset=msvc-14.0"
 
 Review comment:
   Can the MSVC version need to match the current toolset in use? If we are using vs2017 or vs2019 then the toolset version number probably needs to be correspondingly higher here 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on pull request #4769: ARROW-1324: [C++] Support ARROW_BOOST_VENDORED on Windows / MSVC
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4769#discussion_r302181146
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -512,15 +512,34 @@ macro(build_boost)
   set(BOOST_BUILD_PRODUCTS ${BOOST_STATIC_SYSTEM_LIBRARY}
                            ${BOOST_STATIC_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY}
                            ${BOOST_STATIC_REGEX_LIBRARY})
-  set(BOOST_CONFIGURE_COMMAND "./bootstrap.sh" "--prefix=${BOOST_PREFIX}"
-                              "--with-libraries=filesystem,regex,system")
+  if(MSVC)
+    set(BOOST_CONFIGURE_COMMAND "bootstrap.bat" "--prefix=${BOOST_PREFIX}"
+                                "--with-libraries=filesystem,regex,system")
+  else()
+    set(BOOST_CONFIGURE_COMMAND "./bootstrap.sh" "--prefix=${BOOST_PREFIX}"
+                                "--with-libraries=filesystem,regex,system")
+  endif()
+
   if("${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE}" STREQUAL "DEBUG")
     set(BOOST_BUILD_VARIANT "debug")
   else()
     set(BOOST_BUILD_VARIANT "release")
   endif()
-  set(BOOST_BUILD_COMMAND "./b2" "link=${BOOST_BUILD_LINK}"
-                          "variant=${BOOST_BUILD_VARIANT}" "cxxflags=-fPIC")
+  if(MSVC)
+    set(BOOST_BUILD_COMMAND
+        "b2.exe"
+        "link=${BOOST_BUILD_LINK}"
+        "variant=${BOOST_BUILD_VARIANT}"
+        "address-model=64"
+        "toolset=msvc-14.0"
 
 Review comment:
   CMake has a built-in variable `MSVC_TOOLSET_VERSION` which can help here
   ```suggestion
     if(MSVC)
       if(MSVC_TOOLSET_VERSION EQUAL 142)
         set(TOOLSET "msvc-14.2")
       elseif(MSVC_TOOLSET_VERSION EQUAL 141)
         set(TOOLSET "msvc-14.1")
       elseif(MSVC_TOOLSET_VERSION EQUAL 140)
         set(TOOLSET "msvc-14.0")
       else()
         message(SEND_ERROR "unsupported MSVC toolset version, MSVC_TOOLSET_VERSION=${MSVC_TOOLSET_VERSION}") 
       endif()
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #5337: ARROW-1324: [C++] Add support for bundled Boost with MSVC
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5337#issuecomment-530563010
 
 
   > Does it work in debug mode as well?
   
   In this test, we just use "Debug" mode: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5337/files#diff-e403caafa9fe7ef57c326a49e49baef4R52
   
   ```bat
              cmake --build build\cpp --config Debug --target Install
   ```
   
   But I confirmed that this change works with "Release" mode on local machine.
   
   > Also, where does the Github Actions job execute? Does Github provide Windows builders?
   
   GitHub provides Windows builders: https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-github-actions#virtual-environment
   
   > GitHub hosts Linux, macOS, and Windows virtual environments to run your workflows.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
